review: 'Rushmore', Co-Written and Directed by Wes Anderson, is An Awesome Comedy-Drama, that is filled with engaging & interesting moments. The Characters get their due to the strong performances, and the script is brought on screen, with proper execution.About an eccentric teenager named Max Fischer, played remarkably by Jason Schwartzman, his friendship with rich industrialist Herman Blume, played by Bill Murray, and their mutual love for elementary school teacher Rosemary Cross, played Olivia Williams, 'Rushmore' is a treat to watch.Anderson and Owen Wilson's Writing is superb. This cult favorite, as mentioned, is filled with engaging & interesting moments. Even the characters, are so well-defined and diverse from one another. Only thing, I thought the pacing was a bit slow. Especially in the middle, the pacing becomes slow. But a worthy culmination, makes up for it.Anderson's Direction is cool, as well. Cinematography is perfect. Editing is fair. The soundtrack is wonderful. Performance-Wise Jason Schwartzman owns the film with a remarkable performance. Bill Murray is decent, while Olivia Williams is flawless. Mason Gamble is excellent. Luke Wilson appears in a cameo.On the whole, Don't Miss This One! It's Lively, Entertaining & Different. Two Thumbs Up!
